Welcome to Neuron network’s documentation!¶

Gui¶

class Main.App¶

generates GUI for neuron network

add_alpha_event()¶

Switches on and off the field to manually pass alpha parameter

add_test_data_event()¶

Switches on and off the field to manually pass test data

change_appearance_mode_event(new_appearance_mode: str)¶

Sets appearance mode of GUI to “System” (standard), “Dark”, “Light”

Parameters:

new_appearance_mode (str) – string value of chosen appearance mode

clear_data_button_event()¶

Clears training_data_entry, test_date_entry and alpha_entry

execute_button_event()¶

Prepares date from manual entry, executes network with that data and inserts textbox with result of network execute method

learn_button_event()¶

Checks if training data is prepared. If not then textbox is inserted with “Podaj właściwe dane”.

Then it clears tabview if it was filled with data and generates perceptrons list with perceptron to each class from training data. Then each perceptron from perceptron list is learned from training data. Next, each perceptron is added to tabview with specific information about it Finally, textbox is inserted with “Learned” and is_learned field is set to true

open_test_file_event()¶

Opens file dialog to choose test data and writes path to that data to test_data_entry field

open_training_file_event()¶

Opens file dialog to choose training data and writes path to that data to training_data_entry field

save_data_button_event()¶

Saves training data, test data and alpha parameter if are set. Also does read_file() method from Prepare_data module. If file does not exist the textbox field is inserted with “No such {training}/{test} file”

show_button_event()¶

Opens new window with graphic visualization of the neuron network

try_button_event()¶

Firstly, it cheacks if neuron network is learned. Then if checks if test data is set. Next, it counts how much data from test data is classified correctly and textbox is inserted with this information

My vector¶

class My_Vector.My_Vector(data, name='')¶

Simple class that stores data list and name. Is used with neuron network and works as a vector

Network¶

Network.do(perceptron_list, test_data)¶

Gives each data from test_data to each perceptron and increments correct_answers if some perceptron classifies correctly.

Parameters:

  • perceptron_list (list) – a list of perceptrons.

  • test_data (list) – a list of My_Vector that you want to test the network on.

Returns:

correct_answers – count how much data was classified correctly.

Return type:

int

Network.execute(perceptron_list, vec)¶

Gives each perceptron the vector vec. If some perceptron activates then it returns this value. If not, then it returns “Not found”

Parameters:

  • perceptron_list (list) – a list of perceptrons.

  • vec – a vector with data that you want to classify.

Returns:

result – The result of classification or “Not found” if network could not classify this data.

Return type:

str

Network.generate_perceptions_list(training_data, alpha=0.01)¶

Generates a list of perceptrons, every of a uniq class from given training data

Parameters:

training_data (list) – The list of data, that network could learn from

Returns:

perceptron_list – The list of perceptrons of uniq types

Return type:

list

Perceptron¶

class Perceptron.Perceptron(name, training_data, alfa=0.01)¶

Class that represents perceptron.

activation_func(vector)¶

Threshold activation function returns 1 if net is greater or equals 0.

Parameters:

vector (MyVector) – input vector that will be classified by this perceptron.

Returns:

  • 1 (int) – if is activated.

  • 0 (int) – if is not activated.

func(vector)¶

Main function. It activates all methods of this perceptron to classify given vector

Parameters:

vector (MyVector) – input vector that will be classified by this perceptron

Returns:

  • self.name (string) – if perceptron activates

  • ”Null” – if perceptron is not activated

learn()¶

Learn function which completes task of learning process. It counts y, which is result of activate function and calculates new weights vector and new teta. Then it calculates teaching error based on formula “(1/vector.size)*sum.of((d-y)^2)”

net(vector)¶

Dot product minus teta

Parameters:

vector (MyVector) – input vector that will be classified by this perceptron.

Returns:

net – Dot product minus teta.

Return type:

float

new_teta(d, y)¶

Calculates a new teta based on the formula “alfa * (d - y)”

Parameters:

  • d (int) – expected result

  • y (int) – actual result

new_weight(d, y, vector)¶

Calculates a new vector of weights based on the formula “weight + alfa * (d - y) * vector”

Parameters:

  • d (int) – expected result

  • y (int) – actual result

  • vector (MyVector) – input vector that will be classified by this perceptron

weight_draw(length)¶

Draws starting weights for perceptron.

Parameters:

length (int) – the length of weight vector.

Prepare data¶

Prepare_data.count_letters(data: str)¶

Counts occurrences of each letter of the Latin alphabet in data.

Parameters:

data (str) – a text

Returns:

character_occurrence – a list of how much each 26 letters occurrences in data.

Return type:

list

Prepare_data.read_file(path: str)¶

Reads file and generates a list of My_Vector based on the number of occurrences of each letter of the Latin alphabet.

Parameters:

path (str) – path to a file which stores data.

Returns:

a list of My_Vector that can be used with neuron network.

Return type:

vector_list
